title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 03 July 2009 - XWiki

tachirei joined #xwiki at 11:10  
arunreddy\_ - (03/07/2009 11:15): vmassol : Hi  
vmassol - (03/07/2009 11:16): arunreddy\_: hi  
arunreddy\_ - (03/07/2009 11:17): i have implemented importer for mediawiki  
arunreddy\_ - (03/07/2009 11:17): MediaWiki export type XML Dump.  
arunreddy\_ - (03/07/2009 11:18): I have committed the same to sandbox. UI and the Component   
vmassol - (03/07/2009 11:24): arunreddy\_: cool. I'm going on holiday in a few hours, but I'll definitely check it during holiday and try to find some internet connection to give you feedback  
arunreddy\_ - (03/07/2009 11:25): Thanks a lot  
arunreddy\_ - (03/07/2009 11:25): :)  
asyd - (03/07/2009 11:25): s/ 13  
asyd - (03/07/2009 11:25): oups  
vmassol - (03/07/2009 11:25): in the meantime please post a mail on the dev list and ask for feedback from everyone, make sure what you have done can be tested easily  
vmassol - (03/07/2009 11:25): you could provide instructions in the mail so that people can test it  
arunreddy\_ - (03/07/2009 11:25): ok.  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 11:48  
jvdrean left at 12:31 ()  
anamarias joined #xwiki at 12:36  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 12:45  
vmassol left at 12:45 ()  
anamarias left at 12:47 ()  
tachirei - (03/07/2009 12:52): is it possible to use only one Skin Extension Object, not all the object from a page?  
sdumitriu - (03/07/2009 12:52): No  
tachirei - (03/07/2009 12:53): thanks  
sdumitriu - (03/07/2009 12:53): I mean, not using the normal way skin extensions are used  
sdumitriu - (03/07/2009 12:53): In some custom code outside $jsx.use you can do whatever you want with the objects  
tachirei - (03/07/2009 12:57): florinciu: 2 questions:  
tachirei - (03/07/2009 12:57): 1) should I add explicit methods to IXikiClient (and it's implementations) for skin extensions? Or we already have something for this?  
tachirei - (03/07/2009 12:57): 2) do you think that the fact we can not specify a single skin extension object will lead to problems?  
tachirei - (03/07/2009 12:58): for XOffice Style Support, ofc :)  
florinciu - (03/07/2009 13:00): 1) no. the client should map only the api. You should build the specific  functionality in your module  
florinciu - (03/07/2009 13:00): in your case you just need to add an object, i think  
florinciu - (03/07/2009 13:01): adding objects is already in IXWikiClient  
florinciu - (03/07/2009 13:01): 2) not sure  
florinciu - (03/07/2009 13:02): why would you have more then one skin extension object in a document?  
tachirei - (03/07/2009 13:06): an user adds it from web interface, not XOffice  
trifon joined #xwiki at 13:09  
anamarias joined #xwiki at 13:10  
florinciu - (03/07/2009 13:12): meaning that he adds the second one?  
tachirei - (03/07/2009 13:13): second, third, etc... I don't think this will happen often. An user will probably edit current skin extension used in the page, but just in case..  
florinciu - (03/07/2009 13:14): I don't think there would be major problems. I need to digg into this. But we're not there yet.  
tachirei - (03/07/2009 13:15): the question is: from XWord I should delete the skin extension objects, combine them into a single one and add it to the page? or I should only manage XWord skin extension?  
tachirei - (03/07/2009 13:15): yes, we're not there yet. but it's something we need to think about  
cristinaS joined #xwiki at 13:16  
tachirei left #xwiki at 13:24  
trifon\_ left at 13:25 (Connection timed out)  
cristinaS left at 13:33 ("I don't like you. But Bersirc 2.2 does. Try it out now. [ http://www.bersirc.org/ - Open Source IRC ]")  
cristinaS joined #xwiki at 13:33

venkatesh - (03/07/2009 14:17): Hi florinciu sdumitriu  
sdumitriu - (03/07/2009 14:18): Hi venkatesh  
venkatesh - (03/07/2009 14:18): I created some local patches for xmlrpc  
venkatesh - (03/07/2009 14:18): Now, I want to create some xmlrpc-tests  
venkatesh - (03/07/2009 14:18): which I'm unsure of  
venkatesh - (03/07/2009 14:18): any good guide/tutorial/link for how to write Junit tests?  
tachirei joined #xwiki at 14:44  
arunreddy\_ - (03/07/2009 14:51): venkatesh : Test Driven Development by kent beck.   
venkatesh - (03/07/2009 14:51): arunreddy\_ is that a book?  
arunreddy\_ - (03/07/2009 14:52): Yes.   
arunreddy\_ - (03/07/2009 14:52): by the creator   
arunreddy\_ - (03/07/2009 14:52): JUnit in Action - Author vmassol  
asyd - (03/07/2009 14:52): s 20  
asyd - (03/07/2009 14:52): oups  
asyd - (03/07/2009 14:52): ah no, not him! :)  
arunreddy\_ - (03/07/2009 14:54): Oh is tha vincent massol different  
arunreddy\_ - (03/07/2009 14:54): venkatesh: Check your mail.  
venkatesh - (03/07/2009 14:55): arunreddy\_ thanks.  
arunreddy\_ - (03/07/2009 14:55): :)  
sdumitriu - (03/07/2009 14:56): arunreddy\_: No, it's the same vmassol  
arunreddy\_ - (03/07/2009 14:58): is xwiki called pivolis some time back ?  
sdumitriu - (03/07/2009 15:00): No

tachirei - (03/07/2009 16:27): florinciu: can you give me some help with this, please? http://tachirei.pastebin.com/d1a18fa59   
tachirei - (03/07/2009 16:29): I don't understand why it can't find the object with that guid.  
lucaa1 left at 16:32 ("Leaving.")  
florinciu - (03/07/2009 16:35): wrong call :) The third parameter is className not guid  
florinciu - (03/07/2009 16:35): the thrown exception's message is wrong  
tachirei - (03/07/2009 16:35): true. thanks!

arunreddy - (03/07/2009 16:55): sdumitriu: Hi.  
arunreddy - (03/07/2009 16:56): Are there any utils available to work with Zip Attachments.  
arunreddy - (03/07/2009 16:57): Like Reading the files inside a xar file or zip file.  
arunreddy - (03/07/2009 16:57): during Import in XWiki  
sdumitriu - (03/07/2009 17:02): arunreddy: Yes  
arunreddy - (03/07/2009 17:05): sdumitriu : Link ?  
sdumitriu - (03/07/2009 17:06): http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/core/trunk/xwiki-core/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/plugin/zipexplorer/  
arunreddy - (03/07/2009 17:07): Thanks.
